titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arthur Blum Student Lab Book MC.338
titlestmt.author: Jacqueline Rider

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:38:59 -0500.

did.abstract: Arthur A. Blum was a student at New York University's College of Dentistry in the 1920s. This collection consists of his 1922 physiology lab notebook and health publications from the same period.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite, and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a 1922 Physiology Lab textbook, entitled "Directions for Classwork in Experimental Physiology - Stein." It was used by Arthur A. Blum, a student at the New York College of Dentistry in 1924. The book has extensive manuscript diagrams, annotations and marginalia, along with tipped in kymograph readings. A few items of ephemera were laid in behind the front cover. These include a 1921 Bulletin from the NYC Deparment of Health, a Syllabus of Bacteriology, and several more kymograph readings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged in original order.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Arthur A. Blum was a student at New York University's College of Dentistry in the 1920s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Arthur Blum Student Lab Book; MC 338; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in an acid-free box.
